page.title: 02CURRIDGE SCHOOL
page.content: Curridge school was originally a church and a school house owned by Prior's Court for family worship. It was donated to the village by the Parish of Chieveley in the late 19th century. In 1965 the church closed and there is now a Primary school there. One end of the junior classroom is semi-circular and used to have stained glass windows and contained the altar. On the outside walls there are cross shaped patterns made with different brick. It is a small school with only 40 pupils and 2 full-time teachers. This year the oldest children have had the opportunity to do a science project in other schools with other children, but mostly our school day is spent here. 21 of the pupils live at the School of Military Survey and may well move to or from other parts of the world.
